qEC0hUcSe81VP8dyosAw8w.text: Thanks to Yelp, we found this amazing restaurant just a couple of blocks from our Airbnb.  Let me start with the amazing welcoming staff,  they really set the mood for a delightful experience.  The menu looked appealing and every single dish we ordered was perfectly executed.  Finished with a delicious dessert and a pour of smoky scotch. Went back to our place with a fantastic feeling of well being.  We'll be back!

unc2g0krULEFlM1a_r-lfA.text: A spectacular dinner, my absolute favorite in Edinburgh to date.   From the charming tucked-away ambiance and little differently decorated rooms to the attentive and helpful waiters to the delicious food, this was all in all a True 5 star experiance.   High class dining without pretension will always be my holy grail, and Forage and Chatter has done an excellent job of achieving just that. The appetizers, arancini and "mushroom 7 ways" showcased local ingredients, cooking finesse, and creativity. The mains, duck and leek pasta were hearty and satisfying. The dessert, especially the cheese board, was very thoughtfully selected and a great value.   Overall it was awesome. Great service from the staff, who helped us pick wine, and comped a meal at the table behind us at the merest hint of dissatisfaction from the diner. Would, and likely will, return.

photos.caption: Photo of Forage and Chatter - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. A Moelleux au Chocolate
Photo of Forage and Chatter - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. A delicious board of local Scottish cheese.
Photo of Forage and Chatter - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Succulent roast duck with grapefruit consume.

ICmcbmH7OZ4bD1N4hxSegQ.text: If you are in Edinburgh and are looking for a dining experience, this is the place. Staff is very friendly and welcoming.  The food was awesome.  The array of tastes in their dishes were outstanding.  Don't miss is gem in the city.

-ta0ymmkoa15BdYT-GF7OA.text: Came in for lunch with a reservation, which I recommend just so you make sure you get a table. We sat in the back terrace area and it was really charming and cute. The wait staff was very friendly and welcoming. We had a fantastic meal that felt like we were eating the best of Scotland's wonders. The seafood, vegetables, and poultry were all stunning. I walked away with a smile on my face, fully content, full and wishing I could come back immediately. A winner in my book.

photos.caption: Photo of Forage and Chatter - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Forage and Chatter - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Forage and Chatter - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Q74NM_jqMChyHnf8cJHbWg.text: This place was truly incredible. The food was delicious and interesting. I ordered the plaice to start and it was definitely a dish worth noting. The beef was also delicious. Sauces are incredible. I'm not easily impressed by restaurant desserts, but this one was so well balanced. I ordered the strawberry buttermilk ricotta ice cream. Service was friendly and prompt. They didn't seem put off that I was dining on my own. If you are a foodie, I recommend this restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Forage and Chatter - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Forage and Chatter - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

xnknm5maiFaggxjjLz8oTA.text: Scottish Haute Cuisine? An Oxymoron you say? Nay Nay When one utters the words Scottish and food...what comes to mind? Welp usually that lovely delicacy Haggis or perhaps a Scottish egg? Yeah you don't think of Scotland in the same terms as Paris, Copenhagen, or New York or say London now a days.... But you would be wrong! The new food revolution in Scotland is amazing. And Forage and Chatter is a great example of the Culinary offerings of dear ol Edinburgh. Set in a rather residential neighborhood Forage and Chatter is set in a rather unique space. It uses the basement and several other spaces connected together ( room after tiny room). All rooms are dimly lit and add a romantic feeling. yelp.com/biz_photos/fora... We were first offered warm fried bread with a yogurt butter and pesto spread ( good omen of things to come!!!) yelp.com/biz_photos/fora... Our four appetizers were as follows: Winter Vegetable Salad, house-made ricotta, herb oil. Super fresh and bursting with unique flavors. yelp.com/biz_photos/fora... Pearl Barley, cauliflower, wild garlic, herbs, hazelnut. I did not know what to expect of the Pearl Barley but it was an interesting fried grain thing that paired well with all of the other ingridients and had a wonderful texture. yelp.com/biz_photos/fora... My starter (Liver Parfait, hazelnut, mushroom) was an interesting take on foie gras. The flavor was great but the texture was one dimensional...however it went great with the fried bread. yelp.com/biz_photos/fora... The best starter was my wife's Langoustine Bisque, mussels, leeks, fennel. The bisque was poured table side and the flavors were out of this world. You could taste the ocean the brine. The creamy broth was just decadent. yelp.com/biz_photos/fora... Mains were just as stellar: Monkfish, puy lentils, bacon, capers, parsley. If this is on the menu get it. The flavor combo is just so good. Monkfish is similar to lobster and the bacon and lentils combined to give you this meaty textural foodgasm. yelp.com/biz_photos/fora... Semolina Gnocchi, butternut squash, leeks, bonnet goat's cheese. Super fresh vegetarian option with creamy ingredients. yelp.com/biz_photos/fora... North Sea Cod, leeks, potato, herb veloute. My friend Mark ordered this and I had to ask for a bite. The cod was perfectly cooked..crispy outside delecate tender inside. The Veloute was silky and rich. yelp.com/biz_photos/fora... Desserts are not to be missed!!! My Orange Curd, carrot cake, pistachio, white chocolate was so pretty one hesitated to eat it....but it was a lovely delicate ending to my meal. Subtle flavors with rich creamy textures. yelp.com/biz_photos/fora... The other dessert Gin Sponge, apple, juniper, pistachio, elderflower ice cream was equally as beautiful and wonderful to ingest. yelp.com/biz_photos/fora... Fantastic wine list that offers many varieties and prices. yelp.com/biz_photos/fora... Service was phenomenal easy, efficient, and polite: Our Maitre D' was wonderful to chat with and he even offered us a taste of a lovely whisky yelp.com/biz_photos/fora... If you come to Edinburgh this should be on your top five list for dinning experiences

photos.caption: Photo of Forage and Chatter - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Forage and Chatter - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The manager gave me a wee dram of a very special sherry aged bruichladdich. Not peaty or Smokey at all
Photo of Forage and Chatter - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Gin Sponge, apple, juniper, pistachio, elderflower ice cream

gmvv4ymy2t6Ho13PQoCEqA.text: Very good service. Food was fine. We had already cocktail-ed at Panda and Sons, so only had a Bordeaux and Thistly Cross elderflower cider (yum!) The night we went, their WiFi was "down," so they were only accepting cash. Seemed miffed that I hadn't checked voicemail before arriving. A quick dash through the rain to the ATM, and we were sufficiently covered. Update: I got sick after my meal and was up most of the night, although my husband was fine. Perhaps just a bad egg...

Zc5W3ZU8GZf3FwGv8U4kTA.text: What a wonderful find on yelp.  So happy we ate here.  It is quite a special restaurant.   We loved the casual yet elegant vibe.  The food was absolutely delicious and the the service was outstanding.   Every single dish was superb.   This is a farm to table, locally grown cuisine and being from California we loved the fresh and blended tastes.   We highly recommend eating here.

2qPf_0059qZZNOIAkPwmrg.text: This is really an outstanding restaurant. Underground and slightly off the beaten path you wouldn't accidentally stumble into it, but it is well worth the visit. The food hear us creative and fresh, with local ingredients presented in ways I never would have thought of. Attention is paid to texture and color, but most importantly the flavor combinations (which are at times unexpected) are always spot on. Well done!

nDVLytDMmk5L1MyozMnDFw.text: Beautifully executed experirnce!  This place is absolutely a must visit on your trip to Edinburgh. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and the staff were very friendly and welcoming, all with an attention to detail and finesse rivaling the best restaurants in the world. From the amazing food for all 3 courses to the little details like the heated coat closet (so your coats are warm and toasty when you get them before exiting, genius!) . It was the obvious love the staff has for creating a wonderful experience from start to finish, and the passion from the kitchen to serve the freshest, most delicious ingredients without overloading the dishes and letting the fresh seasonal ingredients really shine that make this place so great. I would recommend this place to any and all visitors to Edinburgh, and I will be going back next time I am in your beautiful city. Thank you for an amazing meal. Congrats on all your success thus far, you all deserve it. Sending food love from San Francisco. You all are great!!

xxoEfUiHUmw-jhBdKyZ0lQ.text: What an exceptional restaurant. Flavors were so fine and subtle. Dishes cooked just to perfection. This restaurant is definitely worthy of at least 1 Michelin star.

mUynvb9JOA13oXryfxfZ9g.text: This was a delicious experience for my mom, my niece and myself while in Edinburgh. The service, ambiance and overall 'vibe' of the restaurant was amazing. The food was spectacular with several vegetarian options for my niece and me. All three of us enjoyed the whole experience! (and the  host found us a cab when we left!!!)

UkS27D8oOjs1uVXFM4UUIw.text: A hidden gem that is simply an orgasmic gastronomic treat! All courses not only taste amazing but are equally visually exciting. Highly recommend!!

Vx2KXvR5T8RZlvJ37_XL-w.text: Forage and Chatter is a place that begs you to stay a while. Locally sourced food and drinks, in an extremely convivial atmosphere, what more could you ask for, as the Edinburgh autumn starts to set in. Totally worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Forage and Chatter - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Something that was delicious
Photo of Forage and Chatter - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Beetroot salad, buttermilk, fennel and citrus
Photo of Forage and Chatter - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The opening menu - the agony of choice

EtEh77s1YhmEjJvEHi1_Eg.text: I made reservations two weeks before traveling to Edinburgh, and I'm so glad I did. Here is why:  The food: Our group ordered the North Sea Hake with Mussels, the Monkfish and Barley, the Age Beef, and the potatoes and broccoli. Everything was perfectly cooked. The fish was flavorful, the veggies al dente, and the beef was amazing.  The drinks. The restaurant has a nice selection of cocktails and wines.  The location. Although the spot is small, the owners  managed to make it intimate and comfortable.  The only negative was the service. Our servers could have been friendlier. They need some coaching on menu/ingredient descriptions to help patrons navigate decision making especially when it came to wines. They seemed bothered by the number of questions our group asked.   All in all, the service was a small wrinkle in an overall awesome experience.

tYOEae0VtekO3vj21TQ8-w.text: Came to Forage and Chatter for the first time in November of 2016, and just returned for dinner in my most recent visit to Edinburgh. Both times the food was outstanding. The service is excellent and the atmosphere is great. Highly recommend for date night!

mx1vWQIJnIs89vtbC4jcng.text: Hands down our best meal in Scotland! Gen was our server and she was awesome. Everything we had was delicious (and we are food snobs from Chicago). Reasonably priced and perfectly prepared food. We had a delicious beetroot salad followed by an amazing array of main dishes including the monkfish. The bread with pesto and herb butter was fantastic. We ended with a tasty dessert and a delightful cappuccino.  The ambiance is friendly and relaxing and an enjoyable dining experience.  This is a gem in Edinburgh - just make sure to make a reservation!

C_e4N6jORfoMyYy6eQbFrQ.text: This place was FANTASTIC! The food was amazing and the price was perfect. We're New Yorkers and this would rival anything you could get there. The fish is very fresh, and the sauces are creative. A must-go for any and all! We had terrific service and a lovely chat with the owner. Highly recommend!

ggZhrXC1uDgH-Tm79Imogw.text: Wonderful food. Wonderful service. Best place to eat in Edinburgh and we have been here 7 times.  Cameron is the chef and owner and his brother Nicolas is front of house. Ask for the whisky tasting from Nicolas.
